result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephanie R. NOVAK is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie R. NOVAK

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Motion and Order to Dismiss ordering the action dismissed without prejudice because the defendant is deceased.
$750.00 cash bail returned to Theresa Ohlschmidt by check instruction no: CR 137.
Amended Order for Presentence Investigation. (removing repeater enhancer from charge)

On count 4, the State moves to delete the enhancer.  Motion granted.
To the amended charge of possess heroin, the defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1, 2, 3 and 4, three counts bail jumping and 1 count possess paraphernalia.  Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report.
PSI is due by 09-14-15.
Sentencing is set for 09-22-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Prior: 724 N. 7th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

At 3:53 p.m., $750.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.
The parties have reached an agreement.  Attorney Pangburn requests a new plea date.
Plea date is reset to 07-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Plea date is set for 07-14-15 at 3:30 p.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL  
Attorney Pangburn asks that cash bail be modified to $500.00.
The State objects.  The defendant has five pending files and cannot seem to conform her behavior while out on bail.
The Court will order the bail be modified to $750.00 cash and will add the condition that she report daily to the Manitowoc County Sheriffs Department by Noon and submit to a random urine screen is requested to do so.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.
Minutes.

Motion to Modify Bail.
Cover letter.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 06-10-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess schedule I or II narcotic, possess drug paraphernalia and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-08-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with Travis Koch or Amanda Laurin and that she maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
